intro: Alcmene tobagensis, commonly known as the Togabensis Alcmene, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to flourish. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
